msDesc.head: Homilies and lives of saints; England, s. xii2

msContents.summary: The manuscript contains a collection of Ælfric's homilies, tracts and saints' lives, with other homiletic material by Wulfstan, Latin sermons and musical annotations.

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Second Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies II]: Eighth Sunday after Pentecost (Cameron B.1.2.32)
msItem.incipit: Cum multa turba esset cum nec haberent quod manducarest: ˥ Reliqua. Marcus se godspellere cƿæð on þissum dæ
msItem.explicit: mid godes geƿæpnuge ongean
msItem.note: The text in the manuscript ends at Godden 1979, l. 132, p. 234.

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Second Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies II]: Ninth Sunday after Pentecost (Cameron B.1.2.33)
msItem.incipit: habban god . Þu ƿylt habban hælu . Þines lichoman
msItem.explicit: on ealra ƿoruda ƿoruld. AMEN
msItem.note: The text begins at Godden 1979, l. 111, p. 238.

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Second Sunday after Easter (Cameron B.1.1.19)
msItem.incipit: IN illo Tempore; Dixit iesus discipulis suis EGO sum pastor bonus . ... Ðis godspel þe nu geræd ƿæs
msItem.explicit: ge cariað embe eoƿerne big.
msItem.note: The text includes Clemoes 1997, ll. 1-61, p. 313.

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Second Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies II]: Sixteenth Sunday after Pentecost (Cameron B.1.2.38)
msItem.incipit: sƿyðor cepað; Ne cƿæ he na þæt us beoð
msItem.explicit: ƿurðmynt on ealra ƿorulda ƿoruld; AMEN
msItem.note: The text ends at Godden 1979, l. 107, p. 271.

msItem.title: Music on a four-line stave
msItem.incipit: Salue sanctarum sanctissma
msItem.note: This note was inserted probably xiiex.

msItem.title: Music on a four-line stave written in two columns
msItem.incipit: Salue mater saluatoris
msItem.note: This note was inserted probably s. xii.

msItem.incipit: Spes maria peccatoris

msItem.title: A version of the Homiliary of Angers
msItem.note: These are sixty-seven homilies on the gospels from Lent to Quinquagesima. Nine items are unique to the Bodley version of the homiliary. A transcription and collation is available in Conti 2004.

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: De Initio Creaturae (Cameron B.1.1.2)
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber catholicorum sermonum anglice in anno .I
Sermo ad populum de inicio creature
msItem.incipit: An angin is alræ ðingæ
msItem.explicit: þæt ece lif mid gode þe ðe a on ecnesse rixæd; AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Homilies of Ælfric: Dominica I Post Pentecosten (Cameron B.1.4.13)
msItem.incipit: Erat homo ex phariseis nichodemus nomine; princeps iudeorum & reliqua;Sum phariseisc mon ƿæs ihaten nichodemus
msItem.explicit: þam halgæ gaste on ane godcyndnysse. ƿe cƿeðeþ AMEN.

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Homilies of Ælfric: Dominica V Post Pascha (Cameron B.1.4.8)
msItem.incipit: SUME MEN NUTEN iƿiss for heoræ nytenessæ
msItem.explicit: mid þæs halgæn gastes gyfe. þam is æfre an ƿuldor ˥ an ƿurðment. Amen'.

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Remaining Homilies by Ælfric: Twenty-second Sunday after Pentecost (Cameron B.1.5.6)
msItem.rubric: Erat quidam regulus cuius filius infirmabatur capharnaum & RELINQUIA
msItem.incipit: Ure hælend cóm hƿilon tó chanan

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Remaining Homilies by Ælfric: Twenty-third Sunday after Pentecost (Cameron B.1.5.7)
msItem.incipit: Simile est regnum celorum homini regi & reliqua. CRIstes íƿunæ ƿæs ðæt he ƿolde oft spæcæn
msItem.explicit: beo him á á ƿurðmynt ˥ ƿuldor AMEN. AMEN
msItem.note: Five lines left blank at the end of fol. 11v.

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Second Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies II]: First Sunday in September (Cameron B.1.2.37)
msItem.rubric: De patientia Iob ˥ Constantia . quomodo in dolore firmus in fide perseuerauerit
msItem.incipit: Míne gebroðræ þe rædeþ nu æt godes þenunge be þam eadige ƿære iob
msItem.explicit: þe ðe ane is god á á on ecenysse. AMEN;

msItem.title: Anonymous Homilies, Homilies for Specified Occasions, Sanctorale: Invention of the Cross (Cameron B.3.3.5)
msItem.incipit: HER ONGINNÆÐ to sæcgæn be þam treowe þe ðeo rode ƿæs of íƿroht
msItem.note: Published with a facing-page translation in Napier 1894

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Feria III de dominica oratione (Cameron B.1.1.21)
msItem.incipit: Ðe hælend crist syððan he to þisse liue com
msItem.explicit: on þare he rixæð mid alle his halgum on alre ƿorulda ƿoruld a butan ende. on eccenysse. AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Laurence (Cameron B.1.1.31)
msItem.rubric: Passio sancti laurentii martyris . iiii to . idus augusti
msItem.incipit: ON DECies dæige þæs ƿælreowan caseres
msItem.explicit: he þroƿode mid kene mode monigfealde tintreda mid ðam he orsorglice on ecenysse wynuldræð amen

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Bartholomew (Cameron B.1.1.33)
msItem.rubric: Passio sancti bartholomei apostoli. viii. kalendas. septembris
msItem.incipit: Wyrdwriteræs sæcgæð þet ðreo leodscipæs beoþ ihanten india
msItem.explicit: Sy him ƿyldor ˥ lof. on alre ƿoruldæ ƿoruld. AMEN

msItem.title: Anonymous Homilies, Homilies for Specified Occasions, Sanctorale: Nativity of the Virgin Mary (Cameron B.3.3.18)
msItem.incipit: Men ða leofeste wurðie we nu on andƿeardnysse þa gebyrdtide þære eadige femne sancte matia
msItem.explicit: he us gife sisum lif. ˥ ece eadignyssæ a buton ends. god us to þam fylste. amen

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Second Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies II]: Matthew (Cameron B.1.2.40)
msItem.rubric: Passio sancti mathei apostoli .x kalendas octobris
msItem.incipit: þe apostol matheus and godspellere becom
msItem.explicit: Beo þæs gode lof a buton end on ecnesse. AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Third Series of Homilies [Lives of Saints]: Saint Martin (Cameron B.1.3.30)
msItem.rubric: Incipit uita sancti Martini episcopi .iiia. idus Novembris
msItem.incipit: Sulspicius hatte sum snoter writere
msItem.explicit: þe þe on ecnysse rixæð almihtig ƿealdend.

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Second Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies II]: Twelfth Sunday after Pentecost (Cameron B.1.2.35)
msItem.incipit: DIXIT ieuss ad quosdam
msItem.explicit: þe ðe ane ƿælt alræ isceaftæ. Amen

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Second Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies II]: Assumption of the Virgin (Cameron B.1.2.36)
msItem.incipit: Men þa leofeste hƿilon ær ƿe sæden eoƿ þone pistol
msItem.explicit: Ðe ðe leofæð ˥ rixæð on alræ ƿoruldæ ƿoruld. Amen

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: The Third Sunday after Epiphany (Cameron B.1.1.9)
msItem.incipit: Cum autem descendisset iesus de monte ... Mathevs ðe godspellere ƿrat on ðissere godspellice redinge
msItem.explicit: ˥ an god on ane dogcundnesse effre ƿuniende buton anginne ˥ ende

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Third Series of Homilies [Lives of Saints]: Chair of Saint Peter (Cameron B.1.3.11)
msItem.rubric: XXVIIa. IDUS MARTT CATHEDRA SANCTI PETRI APOSTOLI
msItem.incipit: Ƿe cƿæðæð on gerimcræfte cathedra sancti petri
msItem.explicit: He geƿat þa to heofenum . to hælende criste. ðam is ƿuldor ˥ ƿurðment a on alræ ƿoruldæ ƿoruld. AMEN.

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Annunciation (Cameron B.1.1.14)
msItem.incipit: Vre almihtig scuppend. ðe ðe alle isceaftæ
msItem.explicit: þe ðe ƿeald alle þing mid fæder ˥ mid þam halgæ gaste a on ecnesse. AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Second Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies II]: Septuagesima (Cameron B.1.2.6)
Explanation of Alleluia and Gloria in Excelsis Deo
msItem.incipit: ƿe yllæð sæcgæn bi þisse andwearde tide
msItem.explicit: ƿe him singæð ecelice alleluia buten gesƿinke. Amen

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Second Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies II]: Septuagesima [second part] (Cameron B.1.2.6.1)
msItem.incipit: Simile est regnum celorum homini patrifamilias and RELIQUIA. Se hælend cƿæð
msItem.explicit: þe ðe leofæð ˥ rixæð nu ˥ symle a on ƿorulde. Amen

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Second Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies II]: Sexagesima (Cameron B.1.2.7)
msItem.incipit: Cum turba plurima plurima convenirent as iesum & cetera. Oon sumere tide þa þa mucel meniu samod comen to þam hælende
msItem.explicit: þæt ece lif habben moten on alre ƿoruldæ ƿoruld a buton ende. AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Quinquagesima (Cameron B.1.1.11)
msItem.incipit: Assumpsit iesus duodecim discipulos suos secreto & ait & cetera. Her is ired on þisse godspelle
msItem.explicit: þe ðe leofæð ˥ rixæ a on alræ ƿoruldæ ƿoruld a buton ende AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: First Sunday in Lent (Cameron B.1.1.12)
msItem.incipit: Men þa leofeste ic cyðe eow þæt ðreo þing
msItem.explicit: mid fæder ˥ mid sune ˥ mid þam halge gaste leofæþ ˥ rixæð þurh alræ ƿoruldæ ƿoruld a on ecnesse a buton ende AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Second Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies II]: Second Sunday in Lent (Cameron B.1.2.9)
msItem.incipit: Men þa leofeste Ƿe ƿyllæð her specan feaƿum ƿordum
msItem.explicit: mid fæder. ˥ mid sunu. ˥ mid þam halgum gaste a on alræ ƿoruldæ ƿoruld a buton ende Amen

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Andrew (Cameron B.1.1.40)
msItem.incipit: Ambulans iesus iuxte mare galilee. & RELIQUA; CRist on sume tide ferde ƿið þare galileiscen sæ
msItem.explicit: beo ƿuldor ˥ lof hælende criste a on alræ ƿoruldæ ƿoruld a buton ende Amen.

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Third Series of Homilies [Lives of Saints]: Passion of Saint Edmund (Cameron B.1.3.31 )
msItem.incipit: SVM sƿyðe ilæred munuc
msItem.explicit: a mid his heofenlice fæder ˥ þa [...]

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Sermo 104
msItem.note: The first eight chapters on sins and the appropriate punishments to cleanse them
msItem.incipit: Fundamentum aliud

msItem.title: The Sequence Specialis graciosa uirgo maria with music and a four-line stave

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: First Sunday in Advent (Cameron B.1.1.41)
msItem.incipit: þisses dæges ðenung ˥ ðissere tide mærð
msItem.explicit: ðam beo ƿuldor ˥ lof on ecnesse. AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Second Sunday in Advent (Cameron B.1.1.42)
msItem.incipit: Đe godspellere lucas awrat on ðissum dægðerlican godspelle
msItem.explicit: þe ðe leofað ˥ rixað on alra ƿorulda ƿorld. AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Christmas (Cameron B.1.1.3)
msItem.incipit: Ƿe ƿillað to trumninge eoƿre leafa
msItem.explicit: a on annesse ðæs halgan gastes on ealra ƿeorulda ƿeorld. Amen

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Second Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies II]: Epiphany (Cameron B.1.2.4)
msItem.incipit: Đes dæg is ihaten bocum. Epihphania
msItem.explicit: þe ðe leofað and rixað a buten ende. AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Purification (Cameron B.1.1.10)
msItem.incipit: Postquam impleti sunt dies purgatoris marie & RELIQU. God bead on ðære alde lage
msItem.explicit: Ðe þe leofað ant rixað a buton ende. AMEN

msItem.title: Anonymous Homilies [for unspecified occasions, published]: Napier 1883 [1967], no. 56: 'De Confessione' (Cameron B.3.4.45)
msItem.incipit: Leofa man ic axie þe on drihtnes namen hƿylces geleafan ðu beo to gode
msItem.explicit: he sylf leofað ˥ rixað mid fæder ant sunæ. ˥ halig gast. a on ecnesse AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Palm Sunday (Cameron B.1.1.15)
msItem.incipit: CRITES ðroƿung ƿæs ired nu beforen us
msItem.explicit: þe ðe leofað ˥ rixað a buton ende Amen
msItem.note: On fol. 76v/30, there is Ælfric’s injunction: 'Circlice þeaƿæs forbeodoð to secgenne ænig spel on ðam ðrym sƿygdagas' (for a discussion, see Conti 2004, p. 43, n. 88)

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Cyrclice þeawas (Cameron B.1.1.16)
msItem.quote: Circlice þeawas forbeodað to secgenne ænig spel on ðam ðrym swygdagas

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Easter (Cameron B.1.1.17)
msItem.incipit: Maria magdalene & maria iacobi & salomee & RELIQUA. Oft ge hyrdon embe ðæs hælendes ærist
msItem.explicit: nu ant a on ecnesse AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: In Letania Maiore (Cameron B.1.1.20)
msItem.incipit: Đas dagas beoð ihatene letanie
msItem.explicit: Þe ƿillað nu þis godspel eoƿ reccen. þe her nu ired ƿæs eoƿre leafan to trymmingge.

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: In Letania Maiore [second part] (Cameron B.1.1.20.1)
msItem.explicit: þe ðe leofað ˥ rixað mid fæder ˥ mid halge gaste a buton ende Amen

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Ascension (Cameron B.1.1.23)
msItem.incipit: LVcas þe godspelle us munode on ðisse pistolrædinge
msItem.explicit: Ðe þe leofað ˥ rixað mid þam almihtiga fæder ˥ þam halga gaste. a on ecnesse. Amen Amen

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Pentecost (Cameron B.1.1.24)
msItem.incipit: FRAM ÐAM halgan æsterlican dæge beoð itealde fiftige daga to þisse dæge
msItem.explicit: Ðe þe leofað ˥ rixað a buton ende AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: John the Baptist (Cameron B.1.1.27)
msItem.rubric: Natiuitas Sancti iohannis Baptiste; Uiii. kalendas. Ivlii;
msItem.incipit: Đe GOdspellere lucas aƿrat on cristes bec be accænnednesse Iohannis
msItem.explicit: þam beo ƿuldor ˥ lof mid fæder ˥ galgum gaste a on acnesse AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Peter and Paul (Cameron B.1.1.28)
msItem.rubric: De Passione sanctorum Apostolorum petri & pauli
msItem.incipit: Uenit iesus in partes ... MATHEUS ðe godspellere wrat on ðære godspellicen isetnysse
msItem.explicit: ðe him ne bið ityðod naðor ne synnæ forgifenysse. ne infær ðæs heofenlican rices

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Passion of Peter and Paul (Cameron B.1.1.28.1)
msItem.incipit: Ƿe ƿyllað eafter ðisse godsplle eoƿ ræccan ðara apostola drohtinga
msItem.explicit: ðam beo ƿuldor ˥ lof a on ecnesse. AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Paul (Cameron B.1.1.29)
msItem.incipit: Godes laðung wyrðað þisne dæg
msItem.explicit: heo mid heom ˥ mid gode þæt ece lif habben moten

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Feria III de fide catholica (Cameron B.1.1.22)
msItem.incipit: Ælc cristene man sceal æfter rihte cunnan ægðer ge his pater noster ge his credan
msItem.explicit: þe ðe þurh ƿunæð on þrynnysse an almihtig god. a on ecnesse Amen

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Circumcision (Cameron B.1.1.7)
msItem.incipit: ĐE GODspellere lucas beleac þisses dæges godspel
msItem.explicit: beo him ƿuldor ˥ lof a on ecnysse AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Second Sunday after Pentecost (Cameron B.1.1.25)
msItem.incipit: Homo quidam erat diues et induebatur ... ÞE ƿældendæ drihten sæde þis bigspel
msItem.explicit: heo þreo on annre godcyndnysse ƿuniende butan anginne. ˥ endunge. a on ƿerolde AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Fourth Sunday after Pentecost (Cameron B.1.1.26)
msItem.incipit: Erant adpropinquantes ... Þæt halige godspel us sæð þæt refan ˥ synfulle men neahleacedon
msItem.explicit: þe ðe leofað ˥ rixað mid fader on annesse þæs halgan gastes on alræ ƿorulda ƿoruld. AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Eleventh Sunday after Pentecost (Cameron B.1.1.30)
msItem.incipit: Cum appropinquaret iesus hierusalem ... ON summere tide ƿæs ðe hælende farende
msItem.explicit: Beo ðe lof ˥ ƿuldor on alræ ƿoruldæ ƿoruld. AMEN.

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Seventeenth Sunday after Pentecost (Cameron B.1.1.35)
msItem.incipit: Ibat iesus in ciuitatem que uocatur naim ... URE drihten ferde to sumere burig
msItem.explicit: Heo ðry an ælmihtigæ god unto dæledlic a on ecnysse rixiende. AMEM

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Twenty-First Sunday after Pentecost (Cameron B.1.1.37)
msItem.incipit: Loquebatur iesus ... DRIHTEN ƿæs specende on sumere tide
msItem.explicit: þu ðe leofest ˥ rixost mid ðam ecen fæder ˥ halgum gaste on alræ ƿerolda ƿeoruld AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Remaining Homilies by Ælfric: Wednesday in the Fourth Week of Lent (Cameron B.1.5.2)
msItem.incipit: Preteriens iesus uidit hominem cecum a natiuitate. & RELIQUA Vre drihten ðe mildheortæ hælend
msItem.explicit: ˥ ƿe ƿurdon onlihte ðurh ðone lyfigiendan drihten þa leofæð a on ecnysse. AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Assumption of the Virgin (Cameron B.1.1.32)
msItem.incipit: Hieronimus ðe halga sacerd ƿrat ænne pistol
msItem.explicit: Ðe þe leofæð ˥ rixæð mid fæder ˥ halgæ gaste on alre ƿeorldæ ƿeoruld AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: All Saints (Cameron B.1.1.38)
msItem.incipit: Halige larƿeas sædon þæt seo geleaffule gelaðung
msItem.explicit: þæt ƿe to ðare ecan freolstide becumen

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: All Saints [second part] (Cameron B.1.1.38.1)
msItem.incipit: Uidens iesus turbas asscendit in montem. Et Reliqua. Đæt halige godspel þe lutle ǽr ætforen eoƿ íræd
msItem.explicit: scyppend. ˥ alysend. ealra halgenæ mid fæder. ˥ mid halgum gaste. a on ecenesse AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Second Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies II]: Peter and Paul (Cameron B.1.2.31) (?)
msItem.incipit: Matheus þe godspellere aƿrát on cristes béc
msItem.explicit: on alræ weorulda weoruld á to tídan fore Amen.

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Second Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies II]: James and the Seven Sleepers (Cameron B.1.2.34)
msItem.incipit: On ðissum dæge we wurðiæð on ure lofsange
msItem.explicit: þam is wuldor ˥ wyrdmend on ealræ weoruldæ weorld AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Second Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies II]: Martyrs (Cameron B.1.2.46)
msItem.incipit: Cum audieritis prelia & seditiones nolite terreri & RELIQUA. De hælend foresæde his leorningcnihtum
msItem.explicit: Béo him wuldor ˥ wyrðmynt on alræ weoruldæ weoruld. AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Third Series of Homilies [Lives of Saints]: The Martyrdom of Saint Vincent (Cameron B.1.3.35)
msItem.incipit: Amen amen dico uobis nisi granum frumenti ...Soð soð ic eow secge gif þæt ísawene
msItem.explicit: on anre godcundnesse on áne mægenðryme on anúm gecynde á on ecnesse. AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Second Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies II]: Confessor (Cameron B.1.2.47)
msItem.incipit: Homo quidam peregre proficisscens uocauit seruos suos...URE drihten sæde þis bigspel his leorningcnihtæs
msItem.explicit: Béo lof þam laforde þe leofæð on ecnesse æffre buton ánginne on endeleasúm mægenþrymme Amen

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Second Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies II]: Virgins (Cameron B.1.2.48)
msItem.incipit: Simile est regnum celorum decem uirginibus...Þe hælend sæde bigspel ilomlice be gehwilce þingum
msItem.explicit: Ðe ðe leofæð ˥ rixæð mid his heofenlice fæder ˥ þam halga gaste on ealrae weorlda weorld Amen

msItem.title: Anonymous Homilies [for unspecified occasions, published]: Napier 1883 [1967], no. 46: 'Larspell' (Cameron B.3.4.37)
msItem.incipit: Men ða leofeste cƿæð sanctus greogorius. Ic eoƿ halsige on þone drihten
msItem.explicit: God almihtige us to þam fultumige on ecnesse AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Letters: Letter to Sigeweard (Cameron B.1.8.4)
msItem.incipit: Đe ælmihtigæ scyppend þa þa he englæs isceop
msItem.explicit: ˥ beð for þi isette hi sigefesta dæda on ðam bocum on bibliothecan gode to ƿurðmente

msItem.author: Wulfstan
msItem.title: The Christian Faith: Baptism (Cameron B.2.2.5)
msItem.incipit: Leofe men ealle cristenum manne is mycel neod þæt heo heora fuluhtes scead ƿitan
msItem.explicit: beo lof. ˥ ƿuldor on ealra ƿeorlda ƿerld á buton ende AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Letters: First Old English Letter for Wulfstan (Cameron B.1.8.2)
msItem.incipit: Ælfricus abbas Wulfstano uenerabili archiepiscopo salutem...Us biscopum dafenað þæt ƿe ða boclican lare
msItem.explicit: þæt ge habban þa mæde þe ure hælend behet þam ðe him þeniæð. Euge serue bone ˥ fidelis quia super pauca fuisti fidelis supra multa te co[n]stituam intra in gaudium domini tui sequitur

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Letters: Second Old English Letter for Wulfstan (Cameron B.1.8.3)
msItem.rubric: De secunda epistola quando diuidis crisma
msItem.incipit: Eal'l'æ ge mæssepreostas mine gebroðre ƿe secgæð eoƿ
msItem.explicit: heo ðreo an god æfre rixiende AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Tracts: De Septiformi Spiritu [Be þam halgan gaste] (Cameron B.1.6.3)
msItem.incipit: Spiritus sanctus septenaria operatione ...Isayas þe ƿitegæ wrat on his ƿitegunge be ðam halga gaste
msItem.explicit: Be ðissum ðeaƿum monn mæg þone mon tocnawn hƿæðer him godes gaste on ƿunige. oððe þæs gramlichen deofles

msItem.author: Wulfstan
msItem.title: Eschatalogical Homilies: Antichrist (Cameron B.2.1.1)
msItem.incipit: Interrogatus iesus a discipulis de consummacione seculi dixit eis...Leofa men Ure drihtines apostoli axodon hine sylfne embe þissere ƿeorlde endunge
msItem.explicit: mid þam ðe leofæð ˥ rixæð áá buton ende AMEN
msItem.note: 'About 100 English glosses of s. xv are interlined' (Ker, 1957, p. 368).
msItem.textLang: Old English, glosses in Middle English

msItem.author: Wulfstan
msItem.title: Evil Days: Sermo ad Anglos (Cameron B.2.4.2_a)
msItem.incipit: Leofæn men gecnaƿæð þæt soð is. Ðeos ƿeorld is on ofste
msItem.explicit: þa murhðe þe gad hæfð ígearoƿæd ðam ðe his ƿillan on ƿeorolde ƿurcæð. God ure hælpe AMEN

msItem.author: Wulfstan
msItem.title: The Christian Faith: An Outline of History (Cameron B.2.2.1)
msItem.incipit: Leofæ men. Us is deope beboden þæt we geornlice myngian and læran scylan
msItem.explicit: þenne earnige we us ece blisse æt þam ðe leofæð ˥ rixæð a buton ende AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Second Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies II]: Dedicatio ecclesiae (Cameron B.1.2.49)
msItem.incipit: Mine gebroþræ þa leofestan ƿe ƿylleð sume drihtenlice spæce
msItem.explicit: mid his icorene halgum mid his almihtigæ fæder. ˥ þam halgum gaste on alre ƿeorldæ ƿeorld AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Dedicatio ecclesiae sancti Michaelis (Cameron B.1.1.36)
msItem.incipit: Monegum is cuð þeo halige steow sancti michaelis
msItem.explicit: ðe ðe leofað ˥ rixað á on ecnesse AMEN

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Second Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies II]: Second Sunday after Epiphany (Cameron B.1.2.5)
msItem.incipit: Nuptie quidem facte sunt in chana galilęę & RELIQUA. Iohannes þe godspellere cwæð on þam godspellere lare
msItem.explicit: þe þe leofæð ant rixað mid fæder ˥ þam halga gaste á on ecnesse AMEN

msItem.title: Note on the Age of the Virgin (Cameron B.24.16.3)
msItem.incipit: Sancta maria ƿes ðreo ˥ sixti ƿinter ða heo of middenærde ferde ..
msItem.explicit: ˥ heo ƿes efter him sistene gær on ðissere ƿorlde

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Remaining Homilies by Ælfric: Christmas Day (Cameron B.1.5.1)
msItem.incipit: Ala ge broðræ aræreð eoƿre heorte to ðam heofenlice gode
msItem.explicit: þe ðe mid his ece fæder. ˥ mid þam halgæ gaste leofæð ˥ rixæð á on ecenesse AMEN

msItem.title: Anonymous Homilies [for unspecified occasions, published]: Belfour no. 10 (Cameron B.3.4.1)
Homily for the First Sunday in Lent
msItem.incipit: Men þa leofestæ ƿe ƿullæð eoƿ sæggæn bi þare halgæ tide
msItem.explicit: þam drihtne fultumiende þe ðe leofæð ˥ rixæð áá on ecenesse. AMEN

msItem.title: Anonymous Homilies [for unspecified occasions, published]: Belfour no. 11 (Cameron B.3.4.2)
Homily for Saturday before the Second Sunday in Lent
msItem.incipit: Men þa leofeste sanctus matheus þe godspellere þe ðis godspel wrat ..
msItem.explicit: mis þam heofenlice kynge. þe leofeð ˥ rixæð on alræ worldæ world AMEN

msItem.title: Anonymous Homilies [for unspecified occasions, published]: Belfour no. 12 (Cameron B.3.4.3)
The Transience of Earth Delights
msItem.incipit: Ic eow bidde leofemen þæt sƿa ofte swa ge faren bi ricre monnæ burines
msItem.explicit: almihtig drihten leofæð ant rixæð mid alle his halgæn á abuten ende amen

msItem.title: Dialogue in Latin between Discipulus and Magister on the Lord’s Prayer
msItem.incipit: Pater noster qui es in celis
msItem.explicit: sed potius liberet nos ab omni malo amen.

msItem.title: Dialogue in Latin between Discipulus and Magister on the Creed
msItem.incipit: Credo in deum patrem omnipotentem creatorem celi
msItem.explicit: Amen uero uerbum est ebraicum quoque latine dicitur uere fideliter siue fiat. amen.

msItem.title: Anonymous Homilies [for unspecified occasions, published]: Belfour no. 13: De auaritia (Cameron B.3.4.4)
De auaritia
msItem.incipit: Auarus þæt is gytsere on englisc. auaricia is gytsunge
msItem.explicit: þet ne forleost þu næfre unþances

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Homilies of Ælfric: Feria VI in Quarta Ebdomada Quadragesimae (Cameron B.1.4.6, B.1.5.3)
msItem.incipit: Us sægð þeo halige cristes boc. þæt ure hælend crist arerde þreo men of deaþe
msItem.explicit: sƿa sƿa he dyde ær þurh him sylfum on his andweardnesse

msItem.author: Ælfric
msItem.title: Remaining Homilies by Ælfric: Homily for the Common of a Confessor (Cameron B.1.5.11)
msItem.incipit: Matheus þe godspellere us sæde þis godspel
msItem.explicit: ˥ we sceolon beon gode under ðeode þe alle þing isceop þe þe ane rixæð on ecnesse Amen

msItem.title: The Grave (Cameron A.47)
msItem.incipit: ðe wes bold [ . . ] gebyld. er þu iboren were
msItem.explicit: Næle hit nan mit fingres feire stracien

msItem.author: Alan of Lille
msItem.title: Exposition of the Sequence Ad celebres rex celice
msItem.note: Here attributed to Gerbert (Pope Sylvester II).
msItem.incipit: In primo notandum quod hoc nomen canticum
msItem.explicit: Imaginaria est illa contemplacio

msItem.title: A sermon, beginning imperfectly
msItem.incipit: aliter uero faties domini
msItem.explicit: inimicorum se manifestum demonstrare

msItem.author: Hildebert of Le Mans
msItem.title: Sermones de Tempore 4
msItem.incipit: EGredemini & uidete filie Sicut nemo teste apostolo nouit que sunt hominis
msItem.explicit: Ibi conteemplativa uita uisione

foliation.p: (foliation in roman and arabic numerals: i-xxxix, 1-167, 169-74. Fol. 168 does not occur in the present foliation. The foliation was inserted in pencil on the top right corner of each folio. Fols vi-xxxix were formerly paginated 1-65. Fol. iii was the pastedown at the end: it is now placed, reversed and upside down, at the beginning. Fol. 173 is a medieval flyleaf. Fols i, ii, iv, v, 174 are post-medieval paper flyleaves.

supportDesc.collation: fols vi-xxxix, 1-172: 16, wants 3 and 4 after fol. vii, 2 1, singleton, fol. x before which leaves are missing, 3-58, fols xi-xxxiv, 64+1, 1 singleton after 4, fol. xxxix, 78, 1-8, 84, fols 9-12, 9-148, fols 13-60, 154, fols 61-64, 2 and 3 singleton, 16-238, fols 65-128, 248, missing 3 after fol. 130 and 6 after fols 132, 25-26 8, fols 135-150, 274, fols 151-154, 288, fols 155-162, 298 missing 8 after fol. 170, 302. See also for a recent overview of the construction of the manuscripts the discussion in Conti 2011. No signatures. No catchwords.

condition.p: The manuscript is in good condition, but the quality of the parchment varies. The Latin texts are written on rather thick material (Quires 3-6), suede-like, the same type of material appears from Quire 15 onwards. Holes appear towards the end of the manuscript, for example, fols 107, 109, 114 and 117-118. Because of the size of the manuscript and the writing frame, there are numerous folios which show uneven margins, and the finishing condition of the material is also dissimilar, see for example, fols 114, 119, 125, 127 and 128.

layoutDesc.layout:
fols. vi r-x r: ruled space
240 142
Single frame. Flesh outer. Ruling in brown crayon on both sides of the folio. Single bounding lines. No visible pricking on external margins, but the ruled lines are 9 mm apart within the main frame. Small pricks appear on the top and lower margin to guide the ruling of the vertical bounding lines of the frame. Writing on the first line. See diagram.

fols. xi r-xxxix v: ruled space
240 67
Double columns. Ruling in pencil across the columns, but within the two external bounding lines. Single bounding lines. Small pricks appear on internal margin, near the gutter, and external margins ca. 6 mm apart to guide line ruling still visible, some have been cut prior to binding. Four small pricks appear on the top and lower margin to guide the ruling of the vertical four bounding lines of the columns, which are respectively 70, 9, 70 mm in width. See diagram.

fols. 1r-12/20-64r: ruled space
245 148
Single column. Ruling in pencil within the two external bounding lines. Double bounding lines 10 mm apart. Small pricks appear on the external margins ca. 8 mm apart to guide line ruling still visible, some have been cut prior to binding. Four small pricks, which are still occasionally visible, appear on the top and lower margin to guide the ruling of the vertical bounding line. The first three and last three ruling lines are ruled accross the frame. Fols 13-20 seem to have been pricked internally, bear the gutter. See diagram.

fols. 65r-154v: ruled space
255 160
Single columns. Ruling in pencil within the two external bounding lines. Double bounding lines 6 mm apart. Small pricks appear on the external margins ca. 7 mm apart to guide line ruling still visible, some have been cut prior to binding. Four small pricks appear on the top and lower margin to guide the ruling of the vertical four bounding lines. See diagram.

fols. 155r-170r: ruled space
255 160
Single columns. Ruling in pencil within the two external bounding lines. Double bounding lines 6 mm apart. Small pricks appear on the external and internal margins ca. 7 mm apart to guide line ruling still visible, some have been cut prior to binding. Four small pricks appear on the top and lower margin to guide the ruling of the vertical four bounding lines. See diagram.

fols. 165r-166v: ruled space
238 60
Double columns. Ruling in pencil across the columns, but within the two external bounding lines. Double bounding lines on both side of the column 7 mm apart. Small pricks appear on the external margin ca. 7 mm apart to guide line ruling still visible, some have been cut prior to binding. Seven small pricks appear on the top margin to guide the ruling of the vertical four bounding lines of the columns.

handDesc.summary: Two main scribes copy the majority of the manuscript. One hand works on fols vi-xxxix and another fols 1-170 (see also Ker 1957, p. 374-5). However, other hands seem to be at work for example on fols x, 64v and 170r. On linguistic features of the two main English hands see a recent discussion in Dance 2011.

handNote.p: (fols 1-170) Probably in one hand, but there is some change in style after fols 64, 154. A small clear minuscule.

p.seg: a is Caroline.
d is rounded, of the same size and shape as ð. In Latin d is mainly upright.
e is Caroline.
f is Caroline.
Insular g is used for the spirant and caroline g for the stop. A diagonal hair-line is attached to the base of Caroline and insular forms of g.
h is Caroline
r is Caroline.
s is Caroline, but sometimes it descends below the line, especially when doubled and before t.
descenders turn to the left, except p.
accents are used abundantly on both long and short vowels.
Abbreviation for n or m is marked by a superscript bar, usually straight but occasionally hooked.
cw with a superscript bar denotes cwæð.
discipˉlis denotes discipulis.
A superscript bar over the t in driht denotes drihten.
A crossbar through the ascender of h in heteȝæ denotes heretoȝæ
A superscript bar over m denotes men.
A superscript bar over the c in scs denotes sanctus.
A crossbar through þ denotes þæt.
A hooked d is used for de.
The tironian nota is used for and.

handNote.p: (fols vi-xxxix verso) The scribe uses a type of minuscule characteristic of the mid second half of the twelfth century.

The aspect is upright and engrossed. The hand extends below or above the line of writing in a proportionate way. The scribe mixes Caroline and insular letter forms, and a number of gothic features are also present. f is insular. g is insular. h is insular. r is insular. s is insular. ascenders are slightly wedged. descenders are occasionally tapered to the left.
(fols x, 64v, 154v and the last two lines of 170.) s. xii/xiii.

p.seg: Hybrid forms of f and F.
Insular g is used beside Caroline g.
descenders are occasionally tapered to the left.

musicNotation.p: Music on a four-line stave, fol. x recto, fol. x verso, 64v

decoDesc.decoNote: Initials are mainly red, green, or black. The ornament consists often of red or black circles surrounded by dots. Titles are red or black in the script and hand of the text (Ker 1957, p. 375). Numerous decorated run over words on fols 1-170.
Drawing added, 13th century (?), fol. 173. (Pächt and Alexander iii. 182)

additions.p: Latin annotation: Gaude stirpe regia ... vere dei preciose and lib' Gullelmo rotori pro trauayl ii s, both written in a s. xiii. They appear on (fol. iii), which was originally on the back of the mansucript. The drawing of a bishop on fol. 173 is accompanied by the unexplained inscription ' thn biscopen than wolstane god' in an early thirteenth-century hand.
On fol. 173 there is a drawing of a bishop, perhaps representing Wulfstan with a mitre, probably datable to s. xiii (Madan 1895-1953, p. 354).

accMat.p: An old Bodleian shelfmark NE.F.4.12. with the leather of the spine, which was cut from the former binding is pasted onto the backcover.

history.provenance: It has been suggested that the manuscript has a West Midlands provenance (Ker 1957 p. 375, referring to fols. iii, 173), although Kitson offers the Hereford area as an alternative on the base of some of the dialectal features (for a recent discussion, see Kitson 1992, p. 34 and Wilcox 2008, p. 71 and Conti 2011).
history.acquisition: sir Robert Cotton gave 'Catholici Sermones lingua et charactere Saxonico' to the Bodleian in 1601: the writing on the first leaves, but not the rest, could be called 'Saxon'. Wanley 1705, p. 15'.

recordHist.source: Adapted (March 2022) with permission from description created for The Production and Use of English Manuscripts 1060 to 1220 by Aidan Conti and Orietta Da Rold with the assistance of Helena Cooper and Hollie Morgan (2010; 2013). Previously described in the Summary Catalogue (1922). Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 352 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 353

ref.title: DIAMM: Digital Image Archive of Medieval Music
The Production and Use of English Manuscripts 1060 to 1220
